channel.title: Portforward Without a router (detailed)
channel.description:
Okay it really gets people without routers mad when not even www.portforward.com dosen't have a guide for them. After all if you have one awesome computer whats the point of having a bunch of computers which leads to whats the point of having a router. So lets start with the tutorial...
Go into windows firewall
[IMG]http://i242.photobucket.com/albums/ff75/chase741/TuT1.jpg[/img]
Now click the advanced tab an click the settings button
[IMG]http://i242.photobucket.com/albums/ff75/chase741/TuT2.jpg[/img]
Now Click Add
[IMG]http://i242.photobucket.com/albums/ff75/chase741/TuT3.jpg[/img]
Now
[IMG]http://i242.photobucket.com/albums/ff75/chase741/TuT4.jpg[/img]
Heres how you get the full computer name if you don't know how...
[IMG]http://i242.photobucket.com/albums/ff75/chase741/TuT5.jpg[/img]
Now click the Computer Name tab the part highlighted in purple is your full computer name
[IMG]http://i242.photobucket.com/albums/ff75/chase741/TuT6.jpg[/img]
I hope this TuT stays at the top I'm a noob but I'm learning pretty fast...
For your IP go
Start>Run>cmd>type ipconfig then press enter
Remeber to put the port on exception for windows firewall start>control Panel>Windows Firewall>Click Exceptions Tab>Add Port For name put whatever your server name is for port put 43594 that should be your default port.
Would be very appreciated if a Staff could move this into the Tutorial section :)

item.title: Portforward Without a router (detailed)
item.dc:creator: @Goddess Goddess
item.description:
@Goddess wrote:

LOL you know why? cause you have no router…thats prbly a modem! LOL! and btw windows firewall is crappy its only there to make ppl feel safe…its easy to get around…most major viruses just turn it off lol

Read full topic

item.title: Portforward Without a router (detailed)
item.dc:creator: @ownerzumiez ownerzumiez
item.description:
@ownerzumiez wrote:

i just turned off my enitre firewall

works jsut fine and no viruses

Read full topic

item.title: Portforward Without a router (detailed)
item.dc:creator: @Carrot Carrot
item.description:
@Carrot wrote:

Okay it really gets people without routers mad when not even www.portforward.com dosen’t have a guide for them. After all if you have one awesome computer whats the point of having a bunch of computers which leads to whats the point of having a router. So lets start with the tutorial…

Go into windows firewall

Now click the advanced tab an click the settings button

Now Click Add

Now

Heres how you get the full computer name if you don’t know how…

Now click the Computer Name tab the part highlighted in purple is your full computer name

I hope this TuT stays at the top I’m a noob but I’m learning pretty fast…

For your IP go

Start>Run>cmd>type ipconfig then press enter

Remeber to put the port on exception for windows firewall
start>control Panel>Windows Firewall>Click Exceptions Tab>Add Port
For name put whatever your server name is for port put 43594 that should be your default port.

Would be very appreciated if a Staff could move this into the Tutorial section

Read full topic
